results.title: Challenge of the trade
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, George Cass and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Lucianne New follows the career of Dale Baker, principal dancer with the Australian Ballet including footage of Dale performing one of the leading roles in the popular musical “Cats”. Dale shares his thoughts on being male in a world of dance.

results.title: Challenge of the oceans
results.creator_credit: National Academy of Sciences (U.S.), Lothar Wolff, Hugh Odishaw, Arnold Frutkin and Stanley Ruttenberg
results.brief_description: A study of the physical, chemical and biological aspects of the oceans, showing the scope and objectives of oceanographic exploration. Explores the causes and reasons for the ocean currents and methods of measuring ocean depth.

results.title: Challenge of the north
results.brief_description: The potentialities of the beef cattle industry in northern Australia. An agricultural survey by CSIRO of a large area in northern Australia, coupled with recent research based on experimental farms that have set the stage for a major revolution in agricultural production. Outlines the present status of the cattle industry and illustrates research into beef production. How fodder crops and the by-products from some cash crops, both of which can be grown locally, could bring about a great improvement in the nutrition of beef cattle in the region.

results.title: Challenge of the north
results.creator_credit: Beaconsfield Films, Pilot Films and John Taylor
results.brief_description: A record of the exploits and accomplishments of the British North Greenland Expedition of 1952-54, led by Commander C.T.W. Simpson. The general purpose of this venture was to find the answers to problems of climate, weather and ice, and also to discover how best to live and work in Arctic conditions. Narrated by James Robertson Justice.

results.title: Challenge of the future. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of Energy. Research and Development Branch for Solar Heating and Cooling
results.brief_description: Reviews the problems and options which face the United States in meeting the growing energy crises. Visits a number of laboratories and pilot plants in energy research and development, and shows solar, geothermal, and advanced energy systems as alternatives to petroleum energy sources. Revised version of the motion picture issued in 1975 under the same title.

results.title: Challenge of progress
results.creator_credit: Gold Coast Film Unit and Sean Graham
results.brief_description: Today the Gold Coast (Africa) is no longer a backward country. New roads and buildings are being constructed, people are learning new skills and trades and the country is making rapid political progress. However, democracy canot be superimposed from above. The people of the country must be educated to accept new responsibilities. This film shows how new schools, technical colleges and training centres are being built to bring formal education to the young people of the Gold Coast. At the adult level, mass education projects are under way, through which the adults of the community are learning to read and write, and, more important, are learning how to raise their standard of living.

results.title: Challenge of flight
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations, Vincent Donovan and Don Scheldrup
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Shows the tough and rigorous pilot training courses conducted by the Royal Australian Air Force at Point Cook in Victoria and at Pearce in Western Australia. Only fifty per cent of trainees pass the course.

results.title: Challenge in the desert
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: After assisting Libya to gain independence in 1951, the United Nations has continued to give technical assistance to develop the country. As much of the land is unsuitable for cultivation, future prosperity depends on improving crops. Cooperatives for the citrus fruit and sheep industries have been formed and reforestation and irrigation projects are under way.

results.title: Challenge in the air
results.creator_credit: British Movietone News and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: The Society of British Aircraft Constructor’s 17th Flying Display and Exhibition at Farnborough in 1956, which featured some of the latest developments in British aircraft and aero-engines. Among aircraft on view was the Fairey “Delta 2”, in which Peter Twiss had set up the world air speed record for Britain. Engines were a special feature of the show and demonstrations of the de Havilland “Super Sprite” and Napier “Scorpion” liquid propellent rocket motors are seen.
